issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
Write and Commit responses directly write data to the channel instead of propagating it to the next immediate handler in the channel pipeline. 
Not following Netty channel pipeline model could be problematic. We don't know whether it could cause any resource leak or performance issue especially the internal pipeline implementation keeps changing with newer Netty releases.
fields.summary: NFS WRITE and COMMIT responses should always use the channel pipeline

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12689549/HDFS-7578.001.patch
  against trunk revision 6621c35.

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 3 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  There were no new javadoc warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-nfs hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs-nfs.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/9131//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/9131//console

Thank you, [~clamb]. 
I've updated the bug description to be more accurate and uploaded a new patch to address your comments.

LGTM. Non-binding +1 from me.

Thanks Brandon.

This message is automatically generated.
I think in general it is a good change. An easier approach is to use {{Channel#getRemoteAddress()}} when constructing {{RpcResponse}} instead of propagating it everywhere.

[~wheat9], I am not sure if I got the whole idea. We could use ChannelHandlerConctext to get Channel and then get remoteAddress. Are you suggesting not passing down remoteAddress or ChannelHandlerContext?

The patch looks good to me and I don't see an easy way to simplify constructing {{RpcResponse}}. [~wheat9] if you still remember your idea could you advise?

Luckily the patch still applies.

\\
\\
| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

This message was automatically generated.

The patch does apply and build successfully on my local machine. 

It's also strange that my comment triggered Jenkins. [~aw] Is that expected with the new test script?

bq. It's also strange that my comment triggered Jenkins.  Is that expected with the new test script?

Yup.  That part of the pipeline is before test-patch.sh.  It's always been that way.
002 patch needs a minor rebase, attaching 003 patch to trigger Jenkins.
